virtual ~AbstractToggleAction ()

Detailed Description

Is an abstract base class for actions, which may be toggled between selected and deselected and provide an icon for each state. It's also possible to assign an integer value as value for the action, which is useful when the name or position of a toggle action is not sufficient.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AbstractToggleAction::AbstractToggleAction (   ) 
 

AbstractToggleAction::AbstractToggleAction (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WCHAR *  text,
BOOLEAN  enabled = TRUE,
BOOLEAN  selected = FALSE,
INT  value = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which will be informed about property changes of the action. It is recommended always to specify a dispatcher.
text Text of the action.
enabled Specifies whether the action is enabled. Usually actions which are not enabled may not be executed.
selected Specifies whether the toggle action is in the selected or non selected state.
value Value to the toggle action. This is useful when the name or position of a toggle action is not sufficient.

INT AbstractToggleAction::GetValue (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the value which has been assigned by AbstractToggleAction::SetValue. Having a value is useful when the name or position of a toggle action is not sufficient.
